page.para: Grow, grow, grow!
“Children, I have some magic seeds for you,” said mum. “I will give you one each. There will be a prize for the best plant.”
“A magic seed, mum!” said Harita. “What’s the prize, mum?” asked Aditya. “It’s a secret,” said mum, and she laughed.
Deeksha dug a little hole beside the house. She put the seed in, and put soil on top. She sprinkled water on the soil.
Harita dug a little hole beside the door, and planted her seed. “I will talk to you every day,” she said.
Aditya put his seed in his pocket.
“I must win,” he thought. “I know who can help.”
He ran to his uncle Ajay’s house.
He showed his uncle the magic seed.
“Can you help me, uncle?” he asked. “I want to grow a big strong plant.” So his uncle told him what to do.
Aditya ran home again. He dug a little pit beside the house. He put goat manure and chicken droppings and dead leaves in it. He mixed them with the soil.
Next he put the seed in. He sprinkled water around it.
Then he covered it with soil.
“Grow, grow, grow, magic seed!” he said.
After one month, the plants were already quite big.
“Look mum!” said the children.
“I made a fence for mine, mum,” said Aditya.
Harita looked at her plant quite often. But she did not water it. And then one day … oh no! The plant was dead.
Deeksha looked at her plant every day. She watered it quite often. But then one day … oh no! The goat had eaten it!
But Aditya’s plant grew and grew. It was a beautiful sunflower! Everyone came to look.
“Well done, Aditya,” said uncle Ajay.
“So mum, I get the prize,” said Aditya. “What is it?”
“Well … you all did your best,” laughed mum. “So I’ll give you all a prize.”
“I’ll give you each a garden, and lots of seeds,” said mum. “But Aditya will get the biggest garden.”
“That’s not a prize. That’s work!” thought Aditya. But he did not say anything.
